feed.title: SAP Community - SAP HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Cover Page Text not showing correct PO# when SAP creates Invoices in Mass
entry.content:
Hello Team,

We have as scenario for invoice creation that we need help with. 

1. When we create invoices manually via VF04 the cover page text always works just fine regarding the PO# . Here is what we are using for the cover page text: Inv &VBRK-VBELN& cust &KUAGV-NAME1& &ZZV3-BSTKD&. The field we utilize for PO# is "ZZV3-BSTKD".

2. This issue is when we have the invoices created automatedly via mass. If a customer has more than 1 invoice in the batch run, the 1st PO# is used for the rest of their invoices. See example below for a case.

 

Any ideas on a solution?

entry.title: How to copy route from sales order into delivery
entry.content:
Dear experts,

we have route deterination activated for delivery type via TCode 0VLK which is OK for 80% of the cases.

Now we want the system to copy the manual enterd route from sales order into the delivery instead of perform route determination but only if a specific shipping condition is given.

 

I hoped that I can manage this in copy control from Sales order into delivery by copying routine for delivery FV50C001.

Regrettable this will not help as it seems that the route determination within delivery type will be performed after this routine.

Does anyone has a hint or idea?

Thanks in advance.

Best regards

Patrick

entry.title: We encountered a JDBC connection failure in the SAP HANA database environment.
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I'm encountering a JDBC connection failure in our SAP HANA database environment, and the core error logs are as follows:

(sockfd:403, channel:0x00007f44fb9d2c00, event:0x00007f5e43fdf340, part:62) connection failure. error(600):failed routed execution: routed connection is opened at the same node with anchor, error position:ptime/session/eapi/jdbc/Connection.cc:4374[54823]{-1}[-1/-1] 2025-12-15 17:02:38.711827 e EmbeddedAPI Connection.cc(00884) : anchor conn id mismatch between session: 300145 and sesctx: 338504

SAP HANA Database Version:  hana2.00.046
Network Architecture:  The HANA cluster uses a dual-node setup, with SR synchronization running between the primary and standby nodes.

entry.title: SAP BAdI ME_GUI_PO_CUST: How to Prevent '0' from Displaying in Custom NUMC Fields
entry.content:
I’m working on a line item enhancement for SAP Purchase Orders (eg: via BAdI ME_GUI_PO_CUST).
I’ve added custom fields of type NUMC (numeric character) to the screen.

The issue is: when the field is left blank by the user, it defaults to displaying a series of zeros (e.g. '0' ).

I’d like the field to appear empty (blank) instead of showing all zeros when no value is entered.

What’s the best way to achieve this?

Any advice or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

ABAP Development   SAP enhancement package for SAP ERP MM Purchasing  ABAP Development  #SAP MM #Enhancements

entry.title: SAP HANA SQL Script : substring the string
entry.content:
Hi experts,

 

How to save the part after the last '/' of string using SAP HANA SQL Script ?

For example,

1/22/333 , the part after the last '/'  is '333'.

1/22  -> '22'

1/22/333/4444  -> '4444'

 

Tks.

Just wanted to ask how to address or remove this <ILOAN,ILOA,> in DB02 --> Diagnostics -->Unknown objects in ABAP Dictionary --> DB indexes

SE11 --> ILOA --> Utilities --> Database Object --> Check

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: How to view replicated workforce data (via MDI solution) in S/4 hana private cloud?
entry.content:
AIF monitoring logs tells - Technical data replication for workforce person XXXX is completed, however not able to find this workforce details.

We have not fully enabled Fiori, so how and where can we view this replicated workforce data? Is there any transaction or table, where we can view this workforce data?

entry.title: SAP HANA DB: Recommended OS Settings for RHEL 9
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I currently have a Red Hat Enterprise Linux for SAP Applications Premium subscription and I am preparing a system to install SAP HANA 2.0 on RHEL 9. When running subscription-manager repos --list, I can see only the NetWeaver repositories, and the SAP HANA repositories are not available 

Refering to sap note 3108302 prerequiste is to have Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 (RHEL 9) for SAP Solutions.

My question is if it possible to installe SAP HANA 2.0 on RHEL 9 with RHEL SAP Applications Premium subscription?

entry.title: Bulk upsert in SAP HANA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm using mulesoft to perform bulk upsert in SAP HANA from a source table that has duplicate values, usually I expect to get a return of an array [1,1,1,1,...] but Im getting  [1,1,2,2,3,3,1,1,...]. Does anyone knows what 2 and 3 means?

entry.title: how can we manually maintain SOD in S4 hana without GRC/third party tools.
entry.content: How can we manually maintain SOD in S4 Hana 2022 without GRC/third party tools. Please share any report, documents or videos available?

entry.title: Cross-company stock transfer order（STO）Commitments
entry.content:
Dear expert

We are facing an issue:

When I create Cross-company stock transfer order, the commitment value update, but the stock transfer purchase requisition create the commitment document and the value is zero.
It's so strange refer to the explanation for Question 7 in Note 459509:  Normally, Stock transfer requisition and stock transfer order will not update commitment.

However，we never implement BADI ME_COMMITMENT_STO_CH from 604033 and 2831505.

Cross-company stock transfer order account assignment is related to WBS.

po：

the system Product Version is S4HANA ON PREMISE 2022.

Thank!

entry.title: SAP Basis - What are the programming skills needed in BTP and Hyperscaler automation world ?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Due to the constantly evolving SAP world and changing concepts & tools in the Basis domain area.

What are all the programming language skill sets needed to excel in the BTP AI Gen and Hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, GCP) automation fields for a Basis person ? . OS Shell Scripting and Interface programming are becoming part of the Basis in reality.

Please provide the Programming language details.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Negative stock in WM
entry.content:
Hey everyone!

I recently encountered a problem where I have negative stock in WM, but I don't have the opposite, which would be positive stock to correct this. In SAP MM, I also don't have this balance. So, basically, I have a material/batch that is negative in WM, and I can't move it to any other location or correct it.

From what I understand, the problem occurred because one of the custom movements within SAP was made in a warehouse that wasn't apparently configured. This material was registered with SM and then reversed with EM. In SAP MM, it occurred as expected. However, in SAP WM it didn't. Only the negative stock remains.

Has anyone else experienced this problem? Do you know how to fix it?

entry.title: Inquiry about how to use the EXECUTE_UPDATE method of the CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT class
entry.content:
We used the CL_SQL_CONNECTION, CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT, and CL_SQL_STATEMENT classes in an ABAP program for data DELETE & INSERT processing to a specific Oracle DB. (ADBC)

 

However, we discovered that, perhaps because mass data was transmitted, the requested data deletion/insertion does not work. ( Partially, deleted / input was processed. )

 

First, using CL_SQL_CONNECTION->PREPARE_STATEMENT() we defined the SQL.
(Ex) DELETE FROM ... WHERE A = ? and B = ? .... )

Then, using CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->SET_PARAM_TABLE(), we set the data.

Finally, we called CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->EXECUTE_UPDATE().

 

However, we discovered that the intended number of DELETE/INSERT operations were not being processed.

 

When I reduced the number of transmissions, I confirmed that it operates normally.

How can we determine an appropriate size(SET_PARAM_TABLE),

and could you provide any guide documents or sample programs?

entry.title: houstkeeping the tables , the Data Volume Size/Disk Size still the same
entry.content:
Currently, I am facing an issue regarding database storage.. We have identified data redundancy in some of the database tables and wish to clean up this portion of the data. 

before the junk data was wrote to the table CDPOS and DBTABLOG, the Data Volume Size/Disk Size is 367.33/674.65 , after wrote the junk data is 738.56/974.66. After the housekeeping , the table size already decrease .

My question is: after housekeeping the data, why in DB50 the Data Volume Size/Disk Size still the same(AFTER), but actual the tables size already decrease. How can the system Data Volume Size/Disk Size restore back?

entry.title: Problems with the pricing condition on the SD invoice
entry.content:
Hello

I'm having this problem with the ZPCI internal price condition in PRD. When I review the invoice analysis, the declaration it's showing me is 216, "Value of the condition transferred from previous document."

In the QA environment it shows me the correct value which should be 213 Amount adopted from the material valuation segment.

I checked the V/08, V/06, and VTFL transactions, and all the settings are the same in both PRD and QA. It should be mentioned that when making the delivery, the order created in VA01 shows the correct QA price.

VTFL

V/06

V/08

Does anyone know where else I can check to get the PRD to show me declaration 216?

 

SD Sales SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: FF.5 import multiple bank statements via job
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I would like to import multiple bank statements with the transaction ff.5. As for now it only lets me specify one file at a time. It does not allow a file path like \\server\bankstatements\*.xml. 
Is it possible to specify a folder and not a single file? I would like to create a job with ff.5, so it imports every file in the bankstatements folder everyday.

Thank you.

entry.title: Partially ordered PRs in Ariba
entry.content: When submitting a PR with multiple lines in Ariba, the PR comes back from S4 as partially ordered. Only specific lines get ordered and the others do not. I made a test and added 2 items to the PR out of which only one got ordered (status of the PR - partially ordered). Then I created a PR with only 1 item (the one that did not get ordered in the previous PO) and this time it got ordered. I also created a PO with 8 lines out of which 5 were ordered. What kind of setting might be impacting this?

entry.title: Auto Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Automatic Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Nested Handling Units (HUs) mean packing one Handling Unit inside another Handling Unit.
  • For example, cartons packed into a pallet, where each carton and the pallet have their own HU number.

Step 1: Maintain Packaging Material Types. The menu path is shown in the screenshot below.

Note: I have created 2 Packaging Material types:

  • Pallet
  • Carton

 

Step 2: Define Material group for Packaging Materials

  • Created Packing Material groups for Pallet and Carton.

Step 3: Define Allowed Packaging Materials

  • Map the Packing Material Type with the Packing Material Group

  • Note - For Nested HUs, it is mandatory to cross-map Packing Material Types with Packing Material Groups.

This means:

  • Carton groups must allow pallet types, and
  • Pallet groups must allow carton types,
  • so that inner HUs can be packed into outer HUs without errors.

Step 4: Assign Number Range intervals to Packaging Material Type

  • Assign a number range to the created Packing Material Types for the respective plant and storage location.

Step 5: Created packing materials in MM01 using Material Type VERP and assign the relevant Packing Material Group and Pack. Material Type in the “Matl Grp Pack. Matls, Packing Material type” fields under the Basic Data view/Sales: General Plant data. Additionally, assign the appropriate HU Type and also created SFG Material.

In this scenario, two packing materials are created:

  • CARTONBOX with Packing Material Type CARTON
  • PALLET1 with Packing Material Type PALLET
  • 42 with SFG type.

 

Step 6:  Create Packing Instructions using T-Code: POP1

  • Please note that the Handling Unit (HU) number is generated only for the Load Carrier maintained in a Packaging Instruction.
  • As a result, to generate HUs for both cartons and pallets, each must be defined as a Load Carrier. Since a Packaging Instruction can contain only one Load Carrier, separate Packaging Instructions are required for cartons and pallets.
  • Based on this approach, the following Packaging Instructions have been created:

  • Created Packing Instruction “AutoPack”, added Components for Cotton Box.

 

  • Maintain check profile.

  • Check and save.

  • A separate Packaging Instruction is created for the pallet by adding the PALLET material as Item Category “P” and the AUTOPACK packaging instruction as Item Category “I”. Maintain the required quantities, then check and save.

Step 7: For automatic determination of the Packaging Instruction, create a condition record using T-code POF1.

  • Select “RCPT” standard for Inbound delivery.

  • Assign the SFG material and the ‘PALLET’ Packaging Instruction in the determination record.

Step 8:  Enable Auto Packing in Delivery Types

  • Selected Standard “EL” delivery type for Inbound delivery
  • Enabled “Automatic Packing” and save

The above are the configuration steps. The functional flow is explained below.

  • Created PO by selecting Confirmation key.

  • Create the inbound delivery, select the line item, and click ‘Auto Packing’. The system automatically packs the material.

In this scenario, Material 42 – SFG Material is maintained.

  • Each Carton Box is defined to carry 25 KG of SFG material.
  • Multiple Carton Boxes are then packed into a Pallet, where one pallet contains 4 carton boxes.
  • A Purchase Order is created for 100 KG of 42 SFG material.

During Inbound Delivery Auto Packing, the system performs the packing automatically as follows:

  • 100 KG of SFG material is packed into 4 Carton HUs (25 KG each).
  • These 4 Carton HUs are nested and packed into 1 Pallet HU.

This demonstrates Nested Handling Unit (HU) auto packing, where inner Carton HUs are packed into an outer Pallet HU, and each level is assigned its own HU number automatically by the system.

entry.title: SAP HANA System Components on Database Missing
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

i started the SUM, and when reaching the CHECKS phase, the following error message appears:

“The following SAP HANA System components are missing on the database:
The delivery unit HANA_UMML with version 1.12.8 is not installed on the database.
The plugin SAP_AFL_SDK_APL is available on the source database but is not available on the target database.”

I attempted to import HANA_UMML manually via HANA Studio, but the import failed with the following error:

“Dependent object not found: SqlScript; SAP_PA_APL.**”

I am unable to identify the exact SAP_PA_APL package to download from the SAP Support Portal.
The target database version is SAP HANA 2.00.088.00.1760424921.

Thanks for help in advance!
